l:dependency.name: Javassist
l:dependency.l:description: Javassist (JAVA programming ASSISTant) makes Java bytecode manipulation simple. It is a class library for editing bytecodes in Java.

l:dependency.name: Guava: Google Core Libraries for Java
l:dependency.l:description:
Guava is a suite of core and expanded libraries that include utility classes, google's collections, io classes, and much much more.
Guava has two code dependencies - javax.annotation per the JSR-305 spec and javax.inject per the JSR-330 spec.

l:dependency.name: jersey-repackaged-guava
l:dependency.l:description: Jersey Guava Repackaged

l:dependency.l:description: Functionality to handle JSON input/output for JAX-RS implementations (like Jersey and RESTeasy) using standard Jackson data binding.

l:dependency.name: Jackson-JAXRS-base

l:license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License, Version 2.1

l:dependency.name: aopalliance version 1.0 repackaged as a module
l:dependency.l:description: Generic Modules subsystem

l:dependency.name: JSON in Java
l:dependency.l:description:
JSON is a light-weight, language independent, data interchange format. See http://www.JSON.org/
The files in this package implement JSON encoders/decoders in Java. It also includes the capability to convert between JSON and XML, HTTP headers, Cookies, and CDL.
This is a reference implementation. There is a large number of JSON packages in Java. Perhaps someday the Java community will standardize on one. Until then, choose carefully.
The license includes this restriction: "The software shall be used for good, not evil." If your conscience cannot live with that, then choose a different package.
The package compiles on Java 1.2 thru Java 1.4.

l:dependency.l:description: General data-binding functionality for Jackson: works on core streaming API

l:license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License, Version 2.1

l:dependency.l:description: Jersey JSON Jackson (2.x) entity providers support module.

l:dependency.name: javax.annotation API
